intro: Tithymalus graminifolius subsp. waldsteinii, commonly known as Waldstein's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
